Jaedon uses all his might and rolls himself into the cool water. He feels refreshed and regains a little energy. He stands and wobbles a little. He steadies himself and wads further out into the water.

The female pursuing finishes her horizontal pursuit and is now directly in front of him, still standing on the beach.

She makes a face at him and says, "Oh that's no fair. You know I can't follow you into the water. Maybe you don't know. I can't follow you in the water. I'm suppose to be chasing you and I can't chase you in the water. Get out of there!"

Jaedon feels reveled that his plan worked. "Sorry -, what's your name?"

She looks like she needs sometime to think about it, but replies with "Catithica."

He considers the peculiar name and then says "Sorry, Catithica, but I would prefer to stay alive today and not spend the rest of my life with you. I have friends to find and then get off this island.

"Well you can't stay over there forever," Catithica retorts "To find your friends and eat you need to leave the water, so you will have to eventually. I'll just wait."

He considers this also then says, "You have to eat too. I'll just have to hold out longer then you."
1131212121.title: Into the Ocean

11312121211.content: Jaedon gets hungry as he licks his lips. Catithica senses trouble and starts to swim away, but something happens...
11312121211.title: Jaedon gets hungry first.

11312121212.content:
Catithica hears a noise and realizes it is her stomach. She looks at Jaedon and wishes that she could eat him right there and then, but knew he would never come to shore knowing she's hungry. She decides that her leaving is the best way to lure him out of the water and she can get one of her friends to watch him while she eats. "You know," she tells him "I'm getting hungry. You don't move and I'll be back for you later." She walks back down the beach.

Jaedon can't believe his luck. He hopes she doesn't come back anytime soon. He waits until she disappears back to where he found her before wadding over to the shore. He himself had been getting hungry, but he knew the only chance he had was for her to admit it first.

Somewhere at the tree line, a pair of eyes watch him.

He heads to the trees to see if can find some food, or at least water. Maybe if he can find some of his friends, they have something to eat. That would work out because then he wouldn't have to find food and he's friends would be OK. He starts trudging through the forest.
11312121212.title: Catithica gets hungry.

113121212121.content: Eventually, after who knows how long, he comes to a fork in the road. Down one way, he can see what looks like a garden. In it, he can see rows and rows of corn as far as the eye can see. Down the other road, he can see what appears to be a cantaloupe tree (even though being the educated person he is, he knows the cantaloupes only grow on vines). Someone probably owns the corn, but then again the same could be true with the tree. The corn would be faster to eat though and he is starving. Which way should he go?
113121212121.title: The chance for food.

1131212121212.content:
Jaedon has always loved cantaloupe! Ever sense he was a child, and he declared watermelon to be outrageous, he had always taken it upon himself to eat it when ever he could. He walks down the path to the unrealistic cantaloupe tree. (And who cares how unrealistic it is if it can still fill his empty tummy?) He picks one and wacks it against a nearby rock like one would a coconut. To his delight, it does not smash, but brakes into three large pieces. He eats his fill.

He pockets a few smaller ones in case he were to run into any of his friends and they hadn't eaten lately. He sets off again, deeper into the forest, to see if he could find his friends.
1131212121212.title: To the unrealistic tree.

choices: They fall down into a valley.
11312121212122.content:
Just as the undergrowth is getting taller, the trees are getting wider and the branches are getting lower, he bumps into someone and they both fall over in opposite directions.

"Sarah?" Jaedon asks "Sarah, is that you?"

Sarah looks at him strangely as if he was from a different planet. "Are you talking to me? My name's not Sarah. You should know."

"I do know," says Jaedon "You're my friend Sarah. Have you seen anyone else?"

Sarah shakes her head and says, "If by someone else you mean Jamie, then no. And for the last time my name's not Sarah, it's Zoe."

"Alright, then Zoe," He says sarcastically "Let's go find everyone else." He starts moving past her.

"Yes, Doctor," replies Sarah/Zoe. And she moves to follow him.

He stops, sighs, shakes his head then moves on to try and find his other four friends. He hopes they still have their sanity left.
11312121212122.title: He finds Sarah.

choices: There's nothing he can do against that, save himself.
113121212121221.content:
After a bit of a walk, they are still pushing through the deep underbrush when they bump into a sort of cave that is about two feet tall. They can't see much of it as the brush is so thick; It is hard to see how far back it goes.

"Doctor," says Sarah "Look a cave. Maybe he took refuge from the sunlight or went in to find food or water."

"Stop calling me Doctor," says Jaedon starting to get a little annoyed. The only reason he hasn't taken the time to talk to her about it in depth is because he knows there's dangers on the island and he wants to find his friends and get off the island as soon as possible. He's still not really sure how they are going to do that even if he does find them, but he hopes they might have some ideas. "I hold no degree of any kind and I'm not even interest in the medical field. And I wouldn't go into the cave! It could be dangerous. I've run across dangers and you don't know what kind of things could be hiding in there. There could be a cave in and you'd be trapped in there."

"But what if he's in there?!" replies Sarah "I have to go in and look."

"Fine," he gives in "But I'm staying out here and if anything happens to you, I'm going to find help."

"Deal," says Sarah. She gets on her hands and knees and begins crawling in. "The floor is nice and soft," she calls out to him.

He shifts his weight from foot to foot, still not convinced that this is a smart move. "Are you sure you don't want to look else where for them?"

Her feet disappears inside the opening as she says, "I'm sure. We may not find this cave again. It's getting rather dark in here." She adds.

"What did you expect," yells Jaedon cringing at her stupidity "No light can get in there. We're below the trees, which are blocking the light, as it is."

All of a sudden, the "cave" jerks, Sarah screams and Jaedon hears a loud gulp come from inside the cave.

"Sarah," He yells into the cave which turns out to be a giant mouth. "Are you OK?"

He listens intently and faintly hears "I think I'm OK, Doctor. Someone else is here. I was right about that. I don't think it's Jamie though. He says his name is Ben."

He's not sure whether to feel relieved or concerned. He found one of his friends, but he's a little out of reach. His thoughts are interrupted by the ground shaking and branches braking as he watches the opening Sarah had entered rise. With a good chuck of the brush out of the way, he can clearly see that he was right to be worried about entering that opening. The opening turns out to be the mouth to a dragon! Jaedon would probably be fascinated if he didn't know that two of his friends were now in its stomach.
113121212121221.title: They run into a cave like thing.

1131212121212211.content:
Jaedon hides behind a tree as the dragon snaps at where he was just standing a moment ago. He's glad that he's had a chance to eat and stay out of the sun, so that he's recovered a bit from the last danger. He thinks fast. He would rather not get eaten, but at least Sarah and Ben are still alive, good. Than he has an idea. It's insane, but it would solve three problems at once. He likes those kinds of plans.

He peeks around the tree and says, "Excuse me, Mr. Dragon. I'm 95% sure you can understand me. Clearly you only ate Sarah then and there because you knew I wasn't going to climb in after her. I told her that, so I'm guessing that you heard it and therefore can understand me. I have a deal for you."

The dragon seems to pause and listen, though it's hard to being a dragon and all.

Jaedon gulps and continues, "I'm sure you get hungry a lot. Being a dragon must mean you need to eat often. So I have this offer for you. Give me back my friends and I'll tell you were a whole village of good food is."

The dragon considers it then, at last, speaks in a low rumble, "That's an interesting offer you have to make. I would love to devour a whole village. It would keep me full for a while sense my digestion is slow. Then I wouldn't have to hunt for a while. How do I know you know of such a village?"

"Well," says Jaedon "I can start by describing them to you. They look like a cross between cats and lions. They hate water and- " At that moment Jane (Catithica's friend that was keeping an eye of Jaedon for her), comes running out of the new tree line and yells, "There's no such village. If you want to eat you're going to have to eat him!"

The dragon eyes her, realizing that her being here proves Jaedon's story. The dragon regurgitates Ben and Sarah. Then, as Jane has a disgusted look on her face, the dragon picks her up with it tail and tosses her high in the air. She screams the whole way up, and the whole way down into the dragons open mouth. It swallows and says, "So you were telling the truth after all. Tell me where to find the rest of the delicious foods."

Jaedon thinks to himself 'I guess she should have been a crossbreed between a human and a bird, not a cat.' What he says is "Straight that way than up the coast. Flying you probably could cut some time off, but I don't know if you could find it that way."

The dragon flies off to eat Catithica and the rest of her village as Jaedon goes over the three problems he had solved: He had saved his friends, didn't get eaten himself, and now he doesn't have to worry about being chased by those cat people again.

Now they have to decide what to do next. They still need to find Emily, Becky and Lee. Also, they need to find a way off this island and possible return Sarah's sanity.
1131212121212211.title: Try and recover his friends

11312121212122111.content: Jaedon decides that he needs to find the rest of his friends before anything else. Maybe perhaps even a way off the island. While they look for the other three, Jaedon fill them in on everything he knows about the island and its dangers. He also fills Ben in on Sarah's condition.

Content that the threat has pass you get up, still a bit disorientated from the bash to the head. On your feet now you feel your legs wobble beneath you. Your first step is misjudged and you stumble a few steps then fall over... noisily.. into a bush. Birds fly out of it, chirping away as they do.

"Oh crap..."

The hunt resumed. You still had no idea who or what was after you but again it was, and you were stuck in a bleedin' bush!

You grunted and squirmed but in vein, your clothes were trapped in the twiggy bits of the bush and you had no energy left at all it seemed. All the same, it would be too late, the noise of your pursuer was on top of you, you pulled down the bush on top of you, hoping the leaves would cover you enough...
122222212.title: I am a bush, I am a bush...

choices: She takes you towards the beach
1222222121.content:
You hear that giggle again. "Come out come out wherever you are." The voice laughed.

You could only watch as the biggest shock of your life stepped out into view. You thought you must've knocked your head a little too hard as you saw a 7'ft kangaroo sniff the air as she (well, you asumed from the breasts anyway) searched for you.

The kangaroo woman was obviously sentient since she could speak your language but as strange as all this was and as curious as to how she came to be, her pursuit of you made you want to stay in the bush than approach her...

She sniffed again, she must've picked something up. Her muzzle guided it's way in your direction. Then her eyes focused on you and a smile formed. She slowly approached, as she got closer you could make out each strand of her light brown fur untill the point she was right on top of you.

You noticed her look right at you, it was obvious you were spotted, you couldn't run anymore so you had to give in.

You lifted the bush to reveal yourself from the clumsy hiding place. "Hello?.." You said, not sure what else to say.

"Hi there!" She chirped excitedly. She then tilted her head, "why did the little creature run from me?"

"I er.. er.." You stuttered.

"I just wanted to play.." she said innocently, her face pouting, "I haven't seen one of you before today, what are you?"

"I'm human." You then clicked on to what she said, "wait, where did you see another one of us? Us humans?"

"Over by the beach." She pointed.

"Can you take me there?"

"Don't you want to play instead?" She pouted once more.

"I need to find my friends. Please take me to them." You demanded

"Well..."
1222222121.title: A kangaroo?

12222221211.content:
"I guess I could take you to the beach..."
"Very good, now show me the way."
The kangaroo pointed just behind you so you turned to see where she was pointing. Before you could take a step however, the she-kangaroo grabbed you and stuffed you into her pouch. You struggled for several seconds but the pouch contracted around you, squeezing you tightly. Slowly, you felt your body become melded to the pouch padding.
"Now you're mine. Hold on, you'll be in there for the rest of your life.
With that, the kangaroo licked you on the cheek and hopped off into the forest. You would never be seen again.
12222221211.title: In a Kangroo's Pouch

12222221212.content:
"Ok, I'll take you to them!" She chirped, "They're not far away!"

The kangaroo woman held out her paw to you, at first you jolted back but she tilted her head at your reaction and after a few seconds you decided to grab it. As soon as you did you were pulled hard as she turned and led you into the forest.

"Ow.. slow down." You said as the tug on your arm began to hurt from her inhuman strength.

She turned around and stopped for a moment. "Oh sorry, you humans are so frail! Silly me." She giggled. "It isn't far now."

You went on for five or so minutes, you couldv'e sworn that the beach was the other way. "Um.. you sure you know where you're going, Miss..?"

"Kindra." She smiled. "Of course I know where I'm going." She stopped again. "And we are here."

"What? This isn't a beach?" You then looked around. There was an open clearing, nothing special at first glance but you then noticed a pile of clothes, wait, weren't they Bens?"

"We're here!" She smiled, not letting go of your hand as she dragged you into the clearing.

"Hey! Those are my friend's clothes! Where is he?" You yelled, getting worried for your friend.

"Oh he's close. Why don't you call out for him? He must be around somewhere, can't go far without your clothes." She giggled.

"Ben! Ben!" You screamed at the top of your lungs, looking out to the edges of the clearing for any sign of him.

As you searched for your friend, the roo lady burst out into incontrollable laughter.

"Why are you laughing?" You turned back to face her and she was still giggling.

"Oh I'm sorry, there's something I forgot to mention.."
12222221212.title: The clearing

122222212121.content:
"What did you forget to mention?" You ask nervously, backing up somewhat as her charming though inappropriate laughter changed into a mischevious grin, you then stepped in something that made a soft squishy sound. You looked down.. "Ewww.." You said as you stepped into a nasty pile of mess.

"I told you he was around here somewhere."

"Huh, wha-" You then caught on to what she said.. just about. "You mean that.. he.. the..?" You quickly stepped out of the remains, the remains.. of your friend!! You couldn't breathe properly, such in a panic you were, she had to be kidding!

"I'm sure I can show you EXACTLY where he went." She smiled, tracing her finger over her belly inadvertendly.

"You mean you.. you ate him!?" You gasped.

"Oh, I'm sorry little morsel, that must have been what I forgot to mention." She then smacked her lips in response her belly gurgling hungrily. "Maybe you should just take your clothes off and close your eyes. It'll make this so much easier."
122222212121.title: You can't handle the truth!

1222222121211.content:
"Fuck you!" You yelled. "You killed my friend! WHY?" You then looked at the remains, you couldn't believe this.

"Oh ok, your friend did this the hard way as well. Running only makes you stringy." She sighed. And made a few steps towards you.

"Stay away! S-stay away from me!" You said skittishly, backing away from her step for step.

The roo-lady grinned and took one long step making you almost turn and run. "Hrmm, perhaps this will be just as fun!" She giggled gleefully. "Oh you little humans, I just love how you pretend to not your place in the food chain. Now come here and let me show you." She purred as she advanced at you, slowly though, she wasn't going to chase her food unless she had to.

You remembered how quickly she caught up to you in the forest, not to mention how much stronger she was, what should you do? Your heart was racing, the clearing's edge was quite a distance now, you realised you had been led here for a reason.
1222222121211.title: The fight or flee response

choices: ...force your way down her digestion track.
...climb back up the way you came down.
12222221212111.content: You fling yourself at the kangaroo of outrage. And managed to kick her once on the belly. Then you try to punch her head. She gasped of surprise. Opening her mouth wide ,you find yourself flying into her mouth. Then she swallowed you and rubbed her belly. And she said "You knew you would end up like this." then she slept. You hear the gurgle of her stomach. You want to get out of here. You try to...
12222221212111.title: Fight but lose.

122222212121111.content: The kangaroo was snoring loudly as you forced your way into her intestines. The smell was starting to get to you. After a few thirty minutes you got out of her massive butt. She stirred a little but did not wake up. And now there's a chance to escape. You found a few trees that were fallen down and made a boat with them. Then you found a map that indicates that where you are. Then you finally managed to sail back home in your wooden boat. Leaving the island far far behind.
122222212121111.title: At last, freedom!

choices: It doesn't and she pushes you back down
122222212121112.content: "Not so fast," you scream at the Kanga-lady, she doesn't scare you one bit, "If I know my science right your species are supposed to be Herbivores!" The Kanga-lady pauses for thought, but as she does so you cling to the walls and kick as hard as you can as you clamber upwards... It seems to tickle the insides of her and she giggles, which makes you all the more irritated. Does your ruse work?
122222212121112.title: ...climb back up the way you came down.

12222221212112.content: You don't know how fast she can hop, but you decide to take the long route out as you know that normal kangaroos were herbivores, but these roo creatures on the island were obliviously an exception to the rules. So you decided to run as fast as you can and sprint towards a palm tree, or you could take a dip in the island lagoon and hope for life that the roo-lady couldn't swim!
12222221212112.title: Flee

choices: You hear rumbling from deep in the cave
122222212121122.content:
You see the swamp like pond, diving into the water and swimming out into the middle of the lagoon, trudging through the muddy waters as the kangaroo woman was helpless to catch her meal as it swam away in front of her eyes. You keep going, seeing how strangely large the bayou seemed to be. You see a little grove under a waterfall, surrounded by rocks as you slow down and cross the water.

You swim into the small cave, and see a candle on the wall, letting you see a tunnel which lead to a deeper part of the small cavern. You pull yourself up onto the rocks, and rest for a moment before
122222212121122.title: Kangaroos Can't Swim

choices: "Of course I'm joking! Your kind isn't my taste."
"Of course I ate him. Who would turn down a easy meal"
1222222121212.content: "I'm at least going to take off my shoe's." You say as you kick them on and toss them behind a bush. You turn your attention back to the kangaroo and you ask her. "Is this one of your jokes and games, or did you actually eat my friend." You say trying to keep a tough voice. She looks at you and smiles as she said.
1222222121212.title: Maybe just the shoes...

choices: Look more in the shallow water
13.content:
It was a fishing trip and you still wanted to fish damnit. You roll your trousers up and head into the shallow water. Despite it being a bit selfish to go fishing whilst your friends may be in trouble... dying, dead or otherwise, you convince yourself that the smell of a fish cooking over a fire would attract them.

The water stayed quite shallow not coming up past your knees after about fifty meters. There are only small fish here however, perhaps you could find something worth your effort in catching like a crab if you looked harder, but you might have to either give up or head into deeper water.

The sea looked calm enough, you don't think it would drag you out, but you feel somewhat nervy about swimming out there, possibly cause you just nearly died out at sea... maybe something else.
13.title: Fish? You sure?

131.content:
You abandon your fishing idea, caution getting the better of you.

You leave the water and dry off quickly. You are back to where you started. The water seemed calm enough to you, you give thought to building a light raft out of the trees close to the beach, you aren't sure whether a raft could be succesful from the wood of the tropical trees but you assume it could work but what about your friends? Should you go look for them first you think to yourself... they could be in danger.
131.title: Raft?

1311.content:
You decide to atleast take a closer look at the materials at hand. The whole concept of a raft is somewhat appealing.

There seems to be plenty of good vines around and a minute of looking results in you finding a fist-sized rock with somewhat of a sharp edge to harvest them with.

Then it's time for the timber, you obviously have no means of cutting down trees. But then again you doubt anyone around here has had the means to do any serious logging either so there should be a few dead trees lying around. And dead wood whether it is dry or rotten should be easy to handle even with just a heavy rock you figure.

Then again you could go for thinner things and instead use a lot of them.
1311.title: Can I build a raft?

13111.content:
You venture a bit further into the woods and sure enough there are dead trees here and there some to decomposed to be of any use and some that are just right.

So you start dragging your precious timber back to the beach where you had left a rather decent pile of vines earlier.

Option 1 *Start putting the raft together and add to the raft as you find more material.*

Option 2 *Get a shitload of material first and use the good stuff, because naturally you want a raft you can trust.*
13111.title: Heavy stuff to make a sturdy raft.

131111.content:
Piece by piece the lovely raft of yours is coming together.

Not that it really matters which way the raft travels since when done you hope to have it resemble a square, but for fun you mark fore, aft, port and starboard on it.

The raft still isn't very wide so you tack your trusty stone with you and head back into the woods.

You find a tree you really want but it still has a couple of roots dug into the ground but it looks like you shouldn't have any problem chopping them off with your trusty stone. So you sit down and start to beat them silly as you begin to sing:

"I'm a lumberjack and I'm ok. I sleep all night and I work all day."

And to your surprise someone behind you starts to sing too:

"He cuts down trees. He skips and jumps. He likes to press wild flowers. He puts on women's clothing and hangs around in bars."

As you turn around you see Ben making his way through the undergrowth of the forest.

"So Jaedon what are you up to, sitting here bye yourself in the woods beating an already dead tree?"

"Haa, haaa... Very funny. Regardless of your bad sense of humor I'm glad to see you. As for beating this tree I'm building a raft and your help would be more than appreciated."

"Ahh, yatch replacement!"

"I take that as 'Yes I'll help.'. And another thing, have you seen any of the others?"
131111.title: Fore, aft...

131112.content:
You carry on for several hours pulling usable wood from the forest and dragging it on to the beach.

While taking a breather you look around estimating how much you have to work with and realize that you have a lot more than you need.

Figuring that there's really no reason as to not build large raft you decide to do just that and thus make a larger raft than you had planned.

And you're not a complete idiot so you start building it close to the sea, so that you don't have to push it far to get it into the water.

A while later you have a sturdy raft that is so big you have trouble moving it. But before you launch it into the water you gather what else you might need. A few sturdy poles to propel your craft forward with, (You take three in case they break.) a couple of pointy sticks to use as spears or harpoons or what ever you'd like to call it, your trusty sharp rock and a good length of vines that you fasten to the raft in case you need it.

You consider looking for a stone to use as an anchor but decide it's probably a waste of time and start pushing your craft into the water.
131112.title: Hamster…

1311121.content:
Well there's not really any need for venturing out to deep waters because:
One: Your poles are no more than a few meters long.
Two: how are you supposed to spear something that is further than a meter from the surface?
And three: Who ever said you wouldn't be able to find good enough fish in the shallows?

With your raft you could drift around and hopefully not scare the fish off until if is too late for them.

So you sit down at the edge of the water with one of your pointy sticks and try to be as still as possible.
1311121.title: Ohoy!

choices: Go back, there are other fish in the sea!
13111211.content:
You begin to see many different types of fish swimming around underneath you. You just stare at them for a few minutes trying to decide the best way to go about catching them. You decide that you will try your luck and spear one of them. You jab violently in the water as you try to stab a fish, but they are al just too fast and your accuracy is too poor. After a minute or so of failed attempts you give up and sit on your raft, frustrated at yourself and the fish.

Distracted from the failed fishing attempts, you didn't notice that you have drifted into slightly deeper water until you peered over the edge of your raft again. Suddenly you see a fish staying perfectly still close to the surface!

"This is my chance!" You think to yourself as the fish looks pretty unaware of you being there. The fish however is too far away from you to simply grab or spear at close range. You didn't want to move any closer though, at risk of scaring it off.

You need to make a decision. Throw your spear at the fish or return back to shore?
13111211.title: Ahh fish, finally.

131112111.content:
You take aim at the fish. It's about 6 meters away from you, but totally obtainable with a good enough throw. You raise your arm...take aim aaaanddd THROW!

The moment the spear hits the water however the fish swims away, scared from the impact. You couldn't tell wether your aim was off or that this fish had super reflexes, all you knew was that you were PISSED! But your spear! It was plunging into the deep water below!
131112111.title: Javelin that sucka!

1311121111.content:
Not wanting to lose the spear you took so long to make, you jump straight after your weapon. It was sinking fast but you reckoned you could still catch it!

You dive down into the water and swim after it as fast as you can. You can see it sinking into the abyss, too fast and far from you to obtain. Running out of breath, you take one final look at the spear sinking down and start to swim back to the surface.

You shoot back up and take in a huge gasp of air as you resurface. Your eyes are a bit blurry from the water. You rub your eyes and look for your raft only to discover that it was gone! You have must have gotten caught up in a current as you could see nothing but endless blue all around you!

You panic and shout for help and flail around hopelessly.

"Calm down" you think to yourself. "Your only going to tire yourself out."

You stop screaming and kicking and float, trying to think of what to do now.

Suddenly you feel something brush against your foot! Shocked you swim away as fast as you can, petrified at what it could be!
1311121111.title: Go after it!

13111211112.content:
Suddenly you feel a wet slimy tentacle wrap around your leg and you are violently pulled under. You sink deeper and deeper as this monster pulls you down! You look down at the tentacle gripping your leg to see a huge Octopus dragging you into the abyss. You try and pull off the tentacle with your hands, but they are met with two more tentacles, wrapping around your arms and legs forcing you into a 'hogtie' position.

You are struggling for breath now as you get dragged down deeper and deeper until *THUD!* you hit the sea floor. You are now very weak and have given up hope. You see the Octopus open up its tentacles as it starts to unwrap your from it's grip. Your body is moved into position by the Octopus so that you are face to face with its sharp beak, about 1 meter in height. Still conscious you feel your body being fed into the beak by the tentacles. Your head is the first the enter as you black out from the lack of oxygen. The beak of the Octopus grips shut, decapitating your head from your body. Your lifeless, headless body sinks slowly to the seabed as the Octopus swallows down your head, sliding down its short throat before entering the stomach.

The Octopus now starts to devour the rest of your body, biting off limbs and swallowing down every bit of you in a bloody gory mess. Your remains enter the stomach as they lay there, being churned around and broken down. Your remains have now formed a soupy mixture and begin to get worked through the Octopuses intestines.

Hours pass as the Octopus swims lazily along the sea floor, full from it's latest meal. Your remains enter its anus and the Octopus begins to squeeze you out. You are squirted from its ass hole as a liquidy brown mess and left to float around in the ocean for all eternity.
13111211112.title: It's an Octopus!

choices: Continue fishing, whatever it was is probably full now.
Try to get a look at whatever it was.
13111212.content:
You see a fish that looks large enough to have some meat on it but you miss it with a lot.

It had been too far away so next time you see a fish you wait until you get a little closer, but once again no luck.

You have a few more failures, some fishes are simply too fast some are to deep and sometimes you're just unlucky.

Then while you wait for your raft to drift closer to the latest fish you've set your eyes on you suddenly see something coming from under the raft and in a blur of motion it has disappeared back in under your raft along with your fish.

You got a little startled because you really didn't expect anything grabbing your fish from you especially since it was amongst the largest fishes you've seen so far here in the shallows.

You look around to see if you could spot the thief again but it seems it stayed under your raft.

As you look around you ponder what it was, it didn't really look like a fish did it? Not that you got much of a look at it, but somehow you don't think it was a fish.
13111212.title: WTF!?

131112121.content:
"Well it's not like I got any of the other fishes I've tried catching." You mutter as you sit back down to get ready for the next fish that'll get close enough.

After just a minute you spot another tasty looking fish. Another minute and it is almost within your reach.

Then once again you see something dart out from under your raft and catch your fish. All you manage is to shout out your frustration:

"That one was mine dammit!"

To your surprise the creature stops and swims to the surface looking just as surprised as you.

A meter away from you, you see what can only be described as a mermaid. She has long dark hair that due to it's soaked state clings to her back it obviously reaches further than her waist, but how far is hard to tell since only her waist and up is above the surface.

She is very pretty and has proportionally large perky breasts that you find difficult not to look at. The fact that she's completely naked appears to be something natural for her because she doesn't cover herself up at all. She just looks up at you with her large beautiful eyes.

"It speaks? What is it?"

"It?" You answer taken aback a little not only does she not know what a human is she speaks English too.

She just gives you a funny look and repeats her question. "What is it?"

"I'm Jaerod and I'm a human."

She swims a little closer to you and you suddenly realize that she's not very big at all maybe just a foot and a half from head to tail.
131112121.title: Continue fishing

1311121211.content:
"Human does not mean anything to me."

"Well none the less a human I am. And what might you be?"

Before you got any answer another little beauty surfaced next to the one that you were talking to. This one was just as pretty as the first and the largest difference as far as you could tell was that her hair was almost bloodred in color.

"Eeliin, what is it?" The new mermaid said and pointed at you.

"A human it tells me. Do you know what that is?"

"No, but if it told you that then it speaks."
1311121211.title: Talk

13111212111.content:
"Yes I do. Like I told your friend I'm called Jaerod and I am a human. And what/ who are you?"

"I'm Geala and I'm a Durwuu. I do not know what a human is, so that means I'll have to examine you to find out more about you."

"Examine?" A bit taken aback, you can't reason with her logic. Examining something usually gives you a better knowledge about the thing in question and you find having this little hottie examining you rather appealing too.

"Yes examine. We don't like to leave the water so would you come here instead?"

Geala said and patted the surface in front of her.
13111212111.title: Speak up

131112121111.content:
"Ok."

You said and swung your legs around to jump into the water, but before you could jump in Geala was at your feet and you halted your movements and let her do whatever it was that she wanted to do with your feet.

You could feel her cold little hands on your left foot. She felt your skin on the bottom of your foot and on the top and then she pried your toes apart. You couldn't help but giggle as you are a bit ticklish.

Then she took hold of both your feet and it looked like she licked your right bigtoe, while you continued laughing.

Then you stopped laughing as you stared in shock at her. She had put both your feet into her mouth and swallowed them down in one go.

You gasped for breath unable to find any while she swallowed again and again in rapid successions.

To your horror you couldn't dispatch her eating you as something impossible because below her neck she still looked normal even though your knees were in her throat.

She swam away from the raft as she continued devouring you and effectively pulled you off your floating device.

Now you had to try and stay afloat too and with you in her element her efforts doubled as well as her effectiveness.

In other words once you fell into the water she slurped you up like a wet noodle and in a few seconds her lips closed over your hands and she swallowed one last time, sending you to her stomach.

Inside her stomach it was warm and wet and nasty. It was cramped, but it didn't seem like you filled her up.

Outside Geala licked her lips and patted her flat sexy tummy. "Mmmm... It was delicious. You have to try one if you find one. As for me I could have another right now, or two even."

"Well, don't be too quick, it might be poisonous and give you a stomachache or diarrhea."

"Ok I'll digest it then and we'll find out."

Geala said and concentrated. You could feel her stomach bearing down at you and juices coming from everywhere. In notime you were sliding through her intestines as a nutritious soup. A moment later what little was left of you was squirted out of her lovely bottom.

"See no problem, it digested almost as easy as jellyfish. Now let’s see if we can find more."

Geala said before she left your raft behind to drift into the open ocean.
131112121111.title: Examination.

choices: Resist. Try to get back onboard.
Stay there. She swallows you whole.
131112121112.content:
"What do you mean examine? If you want to know more about me, just ask." You tell her, still rather curious to find out just what this examination will detail.

The one named Geala lets out a frusturated sigh, then looks at you full on with her enchanting, almost hypnotic eyes, "I need to find out if you are edible, and if you taste good. If you don't come into the water, I can't find that out."

Her tone was firm and a tad aggrivated, but for some reason you can't stop looking into her eyes. "If I'm edible? You mean you plan on eating me?" You are suprised that even though are nervous, your voice almost sounded monotone, like a drone or something. Back in high school, you learned about a creature called sirens whose voices had hypnotic powers. You thought things like that were just myths though.

Geala puts her hands on her hips, right where her body becomes fish like, and gives you an annoyed stare. "Duh. Of course! You 'humans' are obviously not a bright bunch. Now get over here." Her tone has become much more menacing, and you find yourself obeidiently climbing over the edge of your raft.

With you now afloat in the water, Geala swims up to you. Suddenly, she drops below the water, breaking eye contact with you. You find clear thought beginning to return to your mind. Maybe you should get out of the water, fast.
131112121112.title: One Hypnotic Gaze

choices: Try to your save your friends
1311121211121.content: Suddenly, everything comes rushing back. You realize your situation, and rush back onboard. You get out of the water just in time, as Geala jumps out of the water, trying to eat you. As you get back to your feet, you see Geala falling down towards you. You managed to get out of way and Geala lands back in the water. You run for your life back into the forest, but suddenly you see Ben and Lee, heading to where Geala was. What do you do?
1311121211121.title: Resist. Try to get back onboard.

1311121211122.content:
Although your mind begins to clear, it just isn't fast enough, for as you start shaking your head to clear out the fog, you suddenly feel a little tug beneath you. "Huh..?" You ask confused, looking down in the water. A shape seems to get closer to the surface, and suddenly, plunges out, all around you. With her mouth open impossibly wide, she swallows you down to her stomach in one quick motion, leaping from the water and coming back down with a splash. The cute redhead lays lazily in the water, patting the rather large buldge you make in her fish half. Giggling, Eeilin comes over and rubs the buldge you make in Geala. "So, what does the chatty thing called a human taste like?" She asks, looking curiously at her friends expression. The red head pats her tummy and licks her lips, "Delicious. It's even better than calamari. Oh, and it wiggles once it's in your tummy too." They both watch in delight as you wriggle in her tummy, causing noticeable buldges and movement in her fish like torso. For you, it isn't so fun, as it smells like rotten fish all around you, and this stingy liquid is pouring in all around you, causing your clothes to dissolve away in her belly.

With her hand rubbing Geala's tummy, Eeilin feels every kick and squirm you make. "Wow. Poor little guy, it must really be unpleasant in their for him." She says with anusement. Geala speaks up, giving you a rough pat, "Don't worry, I'll digest him pretty quickly, his skin doesn't seem to have anything remarkable about it." Indeed, she does digest you pretty quickly, and give out a loud cry as her stomach compacts all around you, acids seeping into your flesh and digesting you. Soon you are a lifeless lump pushing through her intestines. "So, how was he. Did he digest without any complications?" Eeilin asks. Geala nods, and lifting her tail up, she gives a strained grunt. "Ung.. see for yourself!" Suddenly,a couple small, compact, round turds are squeezed from her ass, sinking down to the sea floor. They seem to be a healthy brown in color. "Ahh.. yea, he was great. We have to get more of these things." She says, and the two of them swim off, the red head leaving a small trail of yellow in the water as she pisses out your excess liquids. Congradulations, you are now one of a numerous amount of round, brown turds dotting the sea floor. Aren't you proud of yourself?

Your species soon becomes actively hunted by the Durwuu, and the begin to lay out elaborate traps all over the world, using their equivelant to a fishing rod to bring humans from the land to the water. Soon the ocean takes on a murky greenish brown color from the number of humans that became dung, and the Durwuu raise what little is left of humanity in small bubbles in their underwater cities. No human remains left above the surface of the water, as the elaborate traps bring them to the verge of extiction, only the ones farmed in air bubbles by the Durwuu surviving. The human race has become reduced to being food for the Durwuu, and you are remembered in what little lore humans keep as the one who brought them a taste of human flesh. At least you won't be lonely, as you have lots of putrid, round turds that had once been your fellow humanity all around you, stinking up the waters.

1311121212121.content:
"Damn, those eyes must be getting to me!" You thought to yourself. "I can't eat something that looks so sad..."

"Hey, hey, cheer up, I'm not gonna eat you..." You say, trying to cheer the miniature mermaid up.

She looks up at you, still sniffling slightly. "You, you, aren't?" She asks sadly.

"No, I just wanted to punish you for taking the fish I had caught. That wasn't very nice of you." You say, careful not to scare her.

"Well, if I could give them back to you, if you want..." She says, sticking her finger into her mouth.

"NoNoNoNoNoNo, that's alright..." You say, kinda grossed out. "I'll just catch some more, I mean, there's plenty out there..."

"Well, I can help you." the mermaid says, while getting gobs of your saliva out of her hair.

You look at her skeptically for a second before asking, "Why do you want to help me so bad? I almost ate you, aren't you supposed to, I dunno, be afraid of me?"

"You see, that's exactly it. You had me in your mouth and I couldn't escape. My life was in your hands, and you spared me. In Durwuu culture, that means that I must dedicate my life to you, since in my hands I would've lost it..." She says with a deep bow.

WHAT?! That kinda knocks you on your ass, so to speak. "Hold on, does that mean, you're like my servant now?" You ask, shocked.

"Yes. I must serve you and your descendents, if I outlive you, for the rest of my life." She says subservantly and with another bow.

"Huh, this could work in my favor!" You think excitedly aloud. "With her help, I might be able to survive here, or maybe even escape!"

"Yes master. My species has lived in this area since before the island formed. We know much about this island, the seas around it, and all that exist in them." She answers, still bent over from the bow and not looking at you.

"Is it just me, or is she getting more servant-like by the minute?" You ponder to yourself. "Must be a fish-people, er, Durwoo thing or whatever."

"Alright then. But call me Jaedon, not master. And what's your name?"

"Yes, mast-, er, uh, Jaedon." She corrects herself. "My name is Eeliin."

"Well, nice to meet you Eeliin." You say very politely. "Will you be alright out of the water?"

"Yes, the Durwuu do not dry out as other sea creatures do. Our bodies hold moisture very well. I can make it for 2 weeks out of the water before my body starts to get dehydrated." She says rather proudly. " But, um....thank you for your concern..." She practically whispers, with a blush forming on her face.

"Ok, where should we go then?" You ask, completely oblivious to the blushing mermaid in your hands.

"Well, there's a wrecked vessel up the beach a ways. That may have some things you can use." She says, pointing forward from your position. "Or, in case you're hungry..." She continues, with a bit of embarassment, "We could fish on your raft some more."

So, what'll it be?

1311121212211.title: Yummy Mermaid

Sometimes she simply swallows you whole like the first time, sometimes she cooks you in some way first, but it always ends in you being reborn again and being taken to the kitchen to be prepared for the next meal. What most people fail to realize is that the bigger a snake gets the slower it gets. Anacondas, and boas for example are pretty slow. They have to ambush they're prey. You were hoping that nagas would be similar to actual snakes in that regard(slow in pursuit, but fast on the draw), and if they are Destiny didn't get that memo because she sure isn't slow. 152.content: You don't want to pass out in the sunlight, grabbing your clothes and putting them on you get dressed, the clothes on your back are relativly dry now and you feel a bit refreshed... sort of. Your friends may still be in danger however, your need for food and water rising and you don't know how cold it gets during the night yet, what can follow up that amazing idea of drying your clothes, perhaps you should make a sandman.
152.title: Dry

1522.content:
You try and make a sandman, the sand doesn't stick together well enough. You fail and cry. Sobbing in failure, you forget to drink and die of thirst.

(I felt silly and what did you expect... making a sandman, sheesh...)
1522.title: Dry humour

info.brief_description: Stranded on an island of Vore, survive. Easy, no?
info.description:
You are a twenty-one year old male named Jaedon, you came with a group of five of your friends on a yacht trip when an unexpected storm ripped your ship up and seperated you all along an island no modern human even knew of.

Find your friends, find a way to escape and stay alive in the process if you can.

You don't know whether any of your friends are alive, but if you do find either your mates; Ben and Lee, or your female friends who managed to persuade you to allow them to tag along; Sarah, Emily and Becky on the island, they may help you get off it intact.

If anyone wants to contact me for whatever reason, like what part of the story they want me to add to first, roleplay or just talk, feel free to ask me for my MSN address.

(Mostly open to whatever you want, sex, hard or soft vore, full digestion or not, human predators, furry or other. Just no gay or herm sex between the main character and someone else, anything you want other than that will be fine... probably.

It's a vore interactive but that doesn't mean you have to all centered to being eaten, you could even... *gasp*... survive.)
